column9: I think it's probable that the professors know how to write an exam that has a distribution on it that reflects some sort of mastery over the material. I do think there should be more wiggle room in the % that can receive each grade, so that close exams don't get decided so arbitrarily.
I don't know anything, so I'm neutral about it all.

!!! DO AWAY WITH GPA !!! GPA causes anxiety :( I'm on meds b/c of it.
i think it's fair to not reward participation

"but exact level depends on section re: question system of grading. knowledge only reflects one's knowledge compared to the rest of the section. people who come in with more experience in the subject have short-term grade advantage
We should be like YLS or Berkeley so there's no lettered grades !! (less stress on 1- Strongly DisagreeL!). can have grades for 2- DisagreeL/3- NeutralL
-kind of difficult without first taking an exam. feel a little stresse about the curve, would prefer a grading system purely based on merits, not compared to how other people do on exams
Do profs ever actually boost grades based on participation?

Framing grade reform as a mental health initiative trivializes mental health issues. Perhaps grade reform would have a positive impact on wellness, but grading anxiety is not the same as a mental health issue so resolving that may not correspond to different mental health outcomes.
first semester should be grade non-disclosure (so you find out, employers don't)
